text: Ellsworth F. Bunker (May 11, 1894 â€“ September 27, 1984) was an American businessman and diplomat. He was the ambassador to Argentina, Italy, India, Nepal and South Vietnam). He was an important figure in the war in Vietnam and Southeast Asia during the 1960s and 1970s. ==References== Category:1894 births Category:1984 deaths Category:Ambassadors of the United States to Italy Category:Businesspeople from New York City Category:Politicians from New York City Category:Ambassadors of the United States to India
